A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The phrases "Mandaral," "Mandagoras" and "Mrouw Mannin'" are seen throughout the film. The nameless mother is referred to as a Madam in one scene - probably short for Madame, a generic term of respect used by most cultures for women who run businesses.
